title: Scientific Issue Exploration Through Structured Online Discussions

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental theories and research methods in the sciences
context.additional_context: Learners engage in asynchronous discussion activities in offline environments using personal devices, developing critical thinking on scientific topics.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze scientific issues using four message types—argumentation, critique, evidence presentation, and explanation—in structured online discussions
Learners achieve at least 80% proficiency in thinking levels corresponding to Bloom's cognitive domain taxonomy (understanding–application–analysis–evaluation–synthesis) during discussions
Learners generate critical responses within 48 hours of receiving peer argumentation messages to deepen discussion
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
